speaker: MORRIS
line: Once upon a time there were three... how shall I put this... geeks. Three more unlikely heroes there never were.

speaker: BYERS
line: We defend the defenceless. I don't see any other way.

speaker: MORRIS
line: It wasn't long before their naivete nearly got them killed. So they hooked up with an FBI agent.

speaker: BYERS
line: That's why we like you, Mulder. Your ideas are weirder than ours.

speaker: MORRIS
line: And began publishing a... what shall I call it... rag, called "The Lone Gunman."

speaker: LANGLY
line: The guys at the NSA and the CIA, they tremble every time we put out one of these babies.

speaker: MORRIS
line: From their cramped basement office, they pointed fingers at powerful, evil forces.

speaker: MORRIS
line: And some not so evil. in a metal elevator or something.]

speaker: MORRIS
line: In their own unique way, the three Gunmen were patriots, fighting the good fight. different coloured background. FROHIKE in front of a red background, LANGLY in front of a white background, and BYERS in front of a blue background.] ABC Salvage. FROHIKE trips and falls on his face into the mud.] FLETCHER. LANGLY is speaking and approaching FLETCHER. FLETCHER laughing and smiling.]

speaker: LANGLY
line: We tell the stories others refuse to tell.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Yeah, that's one way to put it. And provided... expertise... for their friends at the FBI. being lowered by BYERS from the roof into the secure computer room from a trapeze triangle.] floor. There are other men in the room. Including LANGLY.]

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She's hot.

speaker: MORRIS
line: For a brief time, it looked as if they might actually make a difference in this cold, cruel world. lowered into something] tunnels.] standing there.] players.]

speaker: MORRIS
line: They acquired an intern who believed in their cause. on FROHIKE.] lightly slapping FROHIKE'S face.] pushing the delivery van and a close up of JIMMY BOND smiling.]

speaker: JIMMY
line: Let's fight the lost causes. I want to help.

speaker: MORRIS
line: And a powerful, beautiful nemesis... is standing there in her black outfit.] YVES from the other side of the door.] goggles and two guns at the same range.]

speaker: MORRIS
line: ... who became an ally. But the world is not kind to idealists... van.] face.] FLETCHER is laughing hysterically.]

speaker: MORRIS
line: ... And those who fight the good fight, don't always win. them.] camera pans backward away from them.]

speaker: BRITTANY
line: Morris? Morris, it's going "ping!"

speaker: MORRIS
line: Oh, it most certainly is.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Ping.

speaker: BRITTANY
line: You're gonna make me spill. Morris, what is all that stuff, anyway?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Now baby, don't make me talk shop. It is so boring.

speaker: BRITTANY
line: But I want to know.

speaker: MORRIS
line: All right. where do I begin? You know we're in the Bermuda Triangle, right?

speaker: BRITTANY
line: Mmmm-hmmm...

speaker: MORRIS
line: That place where all those planes and ships mysteriously disappeared.

speaker: BRITTANY
line: Mmmm-hmmm...

speaker: MORRIS
line: Who do you think named it the "Bermuda Triangle"?

speaker: BRITTANY
line: Wait. You?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Yeah, that was in my former life, before I joined the private sector. There are a lot of things I can't talk about, owing to matters of National Security. But I will say this... there are powerful forces out here. Primal, other worldly forces. Hidden beneath the waves. Just waiting to be... plucked by man.

speaker: BRITTANY
line: Somebody's coming.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Hey, whatever you're sellin', we don't want any, okay? No ghanga.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait!

speaker: MORRIS
line: Uh... Oh, you want the girl? I... I can dig it. I'm down with that.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Uh... Oh, wait, wait, wait, guys! This is a rental! There's a 15 thousand dollar deposit on this

speaker: MAN
line: Your employer wanted me to tell you... You're fired.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Morris Fletcher?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Finally. What took you so long? You must be Reyes. Enchanté.

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah. Mr. Fletcher, we've been told you requested us by name. We're very curious about that.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Well, you two head the FBI's X-Files unit, do you not? I thought you'd appreciate what I have to offer.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Which is?

speaker: MORRIS
line: You have no idea who you're sittin' here with, do you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A guy who's up fudge creek for violatin' the Federal Secrets Act. How's that for starters?

speaker: MORRIS
line: I-I've got Top Security Clearance. I'm supposed to check-in every month with my former employer. So I skipped a few phone calls. Big deal. Let me give you a hint. I used to work at Groom Lake, Nevada. Area 51? I was a man in black. "The" Men in Black. What you've never heard of us?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I saw the movie.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Yeah, well... there were a lot of technical inaccuracies in that thing. Anyway, I'm ready to make a deal.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What deal would that be?

speaker: MORRIS
line: The one that saves my furry pink ass. People are tryin' to kill me. Did you hear about my boat?

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah. Your female companion told us what she witnessed.

speaker: MORRIS
line: My fem... Oh, you mean they didn't kill...

speaker: REYES
line: Brittany? Brittney?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Brittany. Oh... Oh, thank God she's still alive. Look, I need protection. I need to get out of here. You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. I can give you guys the keys to the kingdom. UFO's, aliens, the whole 50 year cover-up. I was there for all of it.

speaker: REYES
line: Tell me, Mr. Fletcher, these documents of yours? Are they indicative of the kind of secrets you can reveal to us?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Honey... they're just the tip of the iceberg.

speaker: REYES
line: This is the Jupiter Two from "Lost In Space."

speaker: MORRIS
line: Okay, yeah. Yeah, those-those-those are B.S. But only those. Yeah, I was freelancing for this foreign billionaire. I told him the Air Force lost a flying saucer in the Bermuda Triangle, and that I could recover it for him. I just wanted to cruise the Bahamas. I never would have given him the real thing. That would be un-American.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Come now.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Look, he found out about it. Now he wants to kill me. I need protection. Super Soldiers.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you know about Super Soldiers?

speaker: MORRIS
line: A bit. It may be there's one I can help you lay your hands on.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This Super Solider... he have a name?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Not "he".... "She".

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What the hell do they want?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Gentlemen.

speaker: REYES
line: What happened here? Did you get robbed?

speaker: LANGLY
line: No...

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Uh, we're upgrading everything.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah. We gave away all our old crap to the Salvation Army. We're buying totally new stuff.

speaker: BYERS
line: Well, what can we do for you, agents?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, we were hoping you could help us out. You know that for months now, we've been investigating this secret cadre. These, uh, so-called Super Soldiers.

speaker: BYERS
line: Genetically altered humans.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You mean the ones that want to kill Mulder.

speaker: REYES
line: Exactly. We'd like your help tracking one down.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This woman.

speaker: REYES
line: Do you recognize her?

speaker: LANGLY
line: She's, uh... she's a fellow hacker. Damn fine one.

speaker: BYERS
line: She calls herself Yves Adele Harlow. Uh, it's not her real name.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, we never learned her real name. She disappeared a year ago and nobody's seen her since.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, we have reason to believe that she's resurfaced, and that she's become one of these Super Soldiers.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What in the hell are you talking about? She's no Super Soldier.

speaker: BYERS
line: Absolutely not.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Not a chance. Who told you that?

speaker: MORRIS
line: This is pointless. These three monkeys couldn't find stink in an outhouse. Why are we even here?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You... son of a...

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Let me at him! I'll kill him!

speaker: LANGLY
line: I'll hold him down!

speaker: REYES
line: Whoa, fellas.

speaker: BYERS
line: You got a nerve coming here.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You little son of a bitch!

speaker: MORRIS
line: Told you they wouldn't help.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, everybody just shut up.

speaker: BYERS
line: This man is a professional liar. every word out of his mouth.

speaker: LANGLY
line: He's a scam artist. He used us to track Yves down a year ago.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And then he abducted her.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Which is why I know what happened to her. I facilitated a meeting, is all. The man I was working for, I didn't know in advance what he was planning to do to her. Not my finest hour. I'll admit it.

speaker: BYERS
line: every word out of his mouth.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Agents, I'm tellin' ya, you don't want these three involved. I mean, they don't even have their ridiculous tinker toy gizmos. This place is like "How The Grinch Stole Radio Shack."

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, you three know this woman, I want your help. We need to track down this Yves Adele Harlow.

speaker: PROFESSOR HOUGHTON
line: Knock, please.

speaker: PROFESSOR HOUGHTON
line: Oh. My office hours are three to five, Mondays and Fridays.

speaker: YVES
line: You'll make time for me, Professor.

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Douglas, are you ready to go? Douglas?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Airline reservation database. What name do we look under?

speaker: BYERS
line: Try her old stand-by. Different anagrams of Lee Harvey Oswald.

speaker: MORRIS
line: "Area 51 Exposé!" Ooo! Where's your new issue? This one's a year old.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Back off, Skeezick.

speaker: MORRIS
line: You'll never find her that way.

speaker: LANGLY
line: He's right. No anagrams for Yves Adele Harlow.

speaker: MORRIS
line: So, who's Joey?

speaker: LANGLY
line: What? Joey Ramone? Leader of the greatest punk rock band in human history. Now shut up!

speaker: LANGLY
line: What?

speaker: MORRIS
line: What are you, 34, 35? Why don't you cut your hair and grow up, huh?

speaker: LANGLY
line: I need to remind you, Fletcher, that Doggett and Reyes aren't here to save you.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Get yourself a real hero, anyway. Not some dead teeny bopper.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You want to know why Joey Ramone's my hero? 'Cause people like you never managed to grind him down. They never stole his spirit. He never gave in, never gave up, and never sold out. Right till his last breath. And he's not dead. Guys like that? They live forever.

speaker: BYERS
line: Langly? Just ignore him.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Look, if we have to work together, let's work together.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We don't have to work together.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Watching you three try and find your butts with both hands is not my idea of a fun time. Now, wouldn't it be easier tracking Yves if you knew her real name?

speaker: BYERS
line: You know her real name?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Lois Runtz.

speaker: BYERS
line: Lois Runtz. Uh-huh.

speaker: MORRIS
line: I'm telling you the truth, boys.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, if you were, it'd be a first.

speaker: BYERS
line: Nobody knows about that door. That's our secret door.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Does Lois know about it? Yves?

speaker: BYERS
line: Jimmy?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Guys...

speaker: LANGLY
line: Jimmy? How you feelin', man?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Oh, right. The old errand boy. The guy used to intern for you losers, right? I wondered what happened to you.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Why is he here?

speaker: BYERS
line: FBI business. It's a long story.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Where the hell ya been, big guy?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Zurich. I was in Malta. And Yemen. And just now, New Jersey. It's been a rough geology lesson. I ran out of money, so I hitch-hiked here. I snuck in the back, 'cause I didn't know if the place was being watched. I just had to see you guys. It's about Lois. Lois Runtz - that's Yves' real name.

speaker: MORRIS
line: I told ya so. Hey, wait a minute. You tracked her all over the world? You? Mr. Brain Power here is lucky to be alive. Why did you send him? Were you tryin' to get him killed?

speaker: LANGLY
line: He sent himself to find Yves. We tried to talk him out of it.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Now I almost wish you had.

speaker: BYERS
line: Jimmy, what is it? Are you all right?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Last night... I traced her to a little college in New Jersey. It's the closest I've been... been in a year of searching. I saw her. I actually laid my eyes on her. I called to her. But she ran. Later on, I... I found out. Guys? I think she murdered somebody.

speaker: YVES
line: One down.

speaker: REYES
line: John Gillnitz? I'm Agent Reyes, and this is Agent Doggett. Is this the woman you saw last night?

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Uh... it was dark, uh... it could have been her. Do you have her in custody?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're workin' on it. Sir, what can you tell us about your friend? Do you have any reason why he may have been targeted?

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Absolutely none. Douglas was a wonderful teacher, and an even better researcher.

speaker: REYES
line: What did he research?

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Elasmo Bronchi. Sharks, rays and skates.

speaker: REYES
line: He was a marine biologist?

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: An immunologist. Sharks have a remarkable immune system. Toxins that would kill nearly any other vertebrate pass right through them.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So he did medical research?

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Douglas wanted to save the world.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Cheer up, Gomer. You're bringin' the whole room down.

speaker: KIMMY
line: This is a computer, Langly. Com-pu-ter. Step away before you embarrass yourself.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Always a pleasure, Kimmy.

speaker: KIMMY
line: Yeah, yeah! So then, how do you wish to partake... of my hacking genius?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, thanks to Jimmy, we know Yves' real name.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Hey, I told ya before he did.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Jimmy also told us what kind of car she's driving. Silver X5 with New York plates.

speaker: KIMMY
line: Really? Way to go, Special Ed.

speaker: BYERS
line: The New Jersey Turnpike has video cameras at every toll booth. Langly hacked the system and spotted her southbound at Newark.

speaker: KIMMY
line: Somewhat creative.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We spotted her again going through the Fort McHenry Tunnel. She passed through not 20 minutes ago.

speaker: BYERS
line: We're betting she's headed for D.C. We're going to try to intercept her, with your help.."

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Think you might find a military satellite you could piggy back? Give us a bird's-eye view of the beltway?

speaker: KIMMY
line: Intriguing. Stand aside, ladies.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We'll be on the cell.

speaker: MORRIS
line: I got shotgun.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Dream on. You're staying here.

speaker: BYERS
line: We need somebody we can trust keeping an eye on Fletcher.

speaker: JIMMY
line: I'm on it.

speaker: MORRIS
line: So, how'd you like Malta?

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: The only thing I can't say for sure is what killed him. He was injected with some sort of tiny poisoned pellet. But the wound in his chest? Was post-mortem.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is that?

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: That's what I said. My best guess is bioluminescence, but, uh, I'm still waitin' to hear back from our lab.

speaker: REYES
line: Bioluminescence? As in the stuff that makes lightning bugs glow?

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: Lightning bugs, plankton, jellyfish. But, uh, generally not dead college professors.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what, this stuff was put on post-mortem?

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: No. As near as I can tell, it bleed out of him. it gets weirder still. When I opened him up, I found adhesions that indicate past surgery, so I'm figuring I'll find he had a bypass or a pacemaker. Instead, I find... this.

speaker: REYES
line: Looks like cartilage.

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: It is. It was living tissue grafted into him. I have absolutely no idea why.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, it held something. Something that's now missing. Could that be the purpose of this wound? A little ad hoc surgery?

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe that was the very purpose of the murder. Whatever was inside him, she removed it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell was inside him?

speaker: MORRIS
line: I have no clue. Seriously, this is the first time hearing of it. Weird organs? I don't know what to tell you.

speaker: REYES
line: You've never heard of the man? Professor Douglas Houghton?

speaker: MORRIS
line: You're looking at me oddly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Perhaps because you've been known to lie on occasion.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Well I'm not lying now. I've said from the start, I didn't know what she was up to.

speaker: KIMMY
line: Dammit! Crashed again! I cannot make magic with sub-standard equipment.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's the problem?

speaker: KIMMY
line: The problem is... it's a freakin' piece of junk! I knew those guys were broke, but this is pathetic.

speaker: REYES
line: The guys are broke?

speaker: KIMMY
line: Are you kidding? Look around this dump. They had to hock all their stuff just to pay the rent.

speaker: MORRIS
line: What about this?

speaker: KIMMY
line: Oh, their "paper"? Deader than disco. They haven't published in months.

speaker: MORRIS
line: So saving the world doesn't pay the bills. There's a hot news flash for ya, huh? What chumps.

speaker: JIMMY
line: They were gettin' by all right, till you put 'em out of business.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Oh. And how exactly did I do that?

speaker: JIMMY
line: When you took Yves. They spent every last dime trying to find her. They're loyal to their friends. Hilarious, huh?

speaker: REYES
line: Reyes.

speaker: BYERS
line: You'd better get here quick.

speaker: REYES
line: Where are you?

speaker: BYERS
line: The Hotel Farragut. Hurry.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She's gonna kill that guy.

speaker: BYERS
line: Doggett and Reyes are on their way.

speaker: LANGLY
line: By then it'll be too late.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yves! Don't do it!

speaker: JIMMY
line: Lois? Should I call you that?

speaker: YVES
line: I prefer Yves.

speaker: LANGLY
line: So... we take it you're not a Super Soldier?

speaker: YVES
line: Super what?

speaker: BYERS
line: Long story. Never mind.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You weren't seriously gonna smoke that guy, were you?

speaker: YVES
line: I know you three mean well. But I can't begin to tell you how badly you've mucked things up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, this guy just up and bolted?

speaker: LANGLY
line: He hit her, and then he took off.

speaker: REYES
line: Nobody's seen him. The room is registered to one Leonard Southhall of Darrian, Connecticut.

speaker: YVES
line: It's an alias.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's a stolen ID. The real Leonard Southhall died in 1996. You want to tell me who that was?

speaker: YVES
line: His real name? I have no idea.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is your bag, isn't it? That was quite a party you got planned for him. Respirator. Surgical gloves. Scalpel. Not to mention this little item here.

speaker: REYES
line: You were planning to cut him open, Ms. Runtz, just like you did the professor. Why?

speaker: JIMMY
line: It can't be true. Tell 'em it's not.

speaker: YVES
line: It is, Jimmy. Time is running short. Unless you let me finish what I started, innocent people will die.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You want to elaborate on that?

speaker: YVES
line: First things first. Who was it that put you on to me?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Okay, guys. So she's not a Super Soldier. I made an honest mistake.

speaker: YVES
line: As I suspected. It's a tracking device. I'm sure he meant to activate it, once he knew you had me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You've been wearin' that since Miami. You were runnin' a scam on us from the start.

speaker: REYES
line: Blowing up the boat, the girl as your witness. You planned all that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That and all the Super Soldier bull. All that was just to hook us.

speaker: BYERS
line: So that you two would, in turn, hook us.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And we'd track down Yves for this slimeball all over again.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Well, what can I tell you? You three always get the job done for me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who do you work for, Fletcher?

speaker: YVES
line: An international arms dealer. A billionaire. And scum of the earth.

speaker: MORRIS
line: And... he's also...

speaker: YVES
line: My father. My father is a murderer, and a supporter of terrorism. I hate everything he stands for.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Yves? You're a murderer, too.

speaker: YVES
line: The man I killed was a terrorist, Jimmy. A zealot whose research was funded by my father for its potential as a weapons system.

speaker: REYES
line: Houghton was an immunologist, doing research on sharks.

speaker: YVES
line: Yes. And he used his knowledge of their immune system to devise a vessel of sorts. One that kept him safe from an engineered virus that he carried within him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This man had living tissue implanted in his chest.

speaker: REYES
line: Cartilage. Shark cartilage. It contained something which you removed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That was this virus you're talkin' about?

speaker: YVES
line: I destroyed it, but it was only one of two.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh, man. The bald dude at the hotel. The one that got away.

speaker: YVES
line: Think of him as a human time bomb. He can pass by any sniff dog, any metal detector, and no one would ever suspect.

speaker: BYERS
line: What triggers this time bomb?

speaker: YVES
line: Programmed cellular death. Genetically altered to a high degree of precision. The way the vessel is decaying inside of him is virtually clock-like. It will lose integrity and rupture at eight o'clock... tonight.

speaker: KIMMY
line: Five hours from now?

speaker: YVES
line: This virus, once it's airborne, its kill radius is five or six miles, depending on the winds. Potentially, it could kill thousands. Tens of thousands.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Fletcher, I knew you were a dirt bag, but still... how could you be a party to this?

speaker: YVES
line: Fletcher's a con-man, not a killer. He didn't know about it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Providing all this is true, how do we track this man down?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Kimmy, zoom in more. Zoom in!

speaker: KIMMY
line: Back off, kibitzer! I'm doin' it! This thing is slower than Stumpy, my one-legged Granny. Where did you get this dinosaur turd?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Stop bellyachin' and work.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Those things'll kill ya, ya know?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's why I quit 20 years ago. You want one?

speaker: MORRIS
line: So, you're too broke to publish, huh? Pencil neck told me. It's a shame. This little rag always was such a hoot. I'm gonna miss it. But, hey, the world spins on, right? Maybe saving it is a younger man's game. Or a woman's.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Maybe it is. You gotta admit, Byers. It hasn't exactly been our year. And to top it all off, we screwed the pooch pretty good today. Maybe we should pack it in.

speaker: BYERS
line: And do what instead? We never gave up. We never will. In the end, if that's the best they can say about us,... it'll do.

speaker: LANGLY
line: I got him!

speaker: KIMMY
line: Hey, it's my hack, Langly. I got him.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We got him, all right? Our bad guy just rented a blue Corolla under his alias Leonard Southhall. We just picked him up on Kimmy's satellite.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Haulin' north like a bat out of hell.

speaker: KIMMY
line: New Jersey Turnpike, 30 miles south of Newark.

speaker: YVES
line: I think I know where he's headed.

speaker: BYERS
line: Lone Gunman Newspaper Group. Byers speaking.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Byers? John Doggett.

speaker: BYERS
line: Agent Doggett. Do you have him?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oh yeah, we got him. Listen, how much do you trust this Yves Harlow, Lois Runtz, whatever name she's tellin' you?

speaker: BYERS
line: Completely. Why?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Because the doctors here have run every kind of imaging on this guy, Southhall, and come up snake eyes. No virus, no cartilage vessel in his chest, nothin'.

speaker: BYERS
line: They found nothing.

speaker: YVES
line: That doesn't make sense.

speaker: BYERS
line: They're absolutely certain?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: One hundred percent. Agent Reyes and I are lookin' like a couple of fools on this one.

speaker: BYERS
line: There must be something we missed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All I can tell you is, we got the wrong guy.

speaker: YVES
line: There must be a second man. I know there is. It's Basic Terrorism 101.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Except we don't know his name, and we don't know his target.

speaker: JIMMY
line: And we've got one hour to find him.

speaker: EVENING SESSION 7
line: 00 PM

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Good Evening.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: You're good.

speaker: YVES
line: All my information pointed to that man, Leonard Southhall. He goes by an alias, he traveled to Washington on this very day.

speaker: BYERS
line: Clearly, he's involved somehow.

speaker: JIMMY
line: He must be. He made a beeline right back to that biology department where the dead Professor worked.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Their base of operation.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah. So if Southhall is involved, and yet he doesn't have the virus inside of him...?

speaker: YVES
line: So how exactly does he fit into their plan?

speaker: MORRIS
line: Three card Monty. You ever played it? You have now.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: MORRIS
line: It means these guys have you running after the Ace, when you should be chasing the Queen.

speaker: YVES
line: Oh, my God. Southhall is the decoy. That's all he is.

speaker: MORRIS
line: They knew that you were hot on their trail, so they gave you someone else to follow.

speaker: JIMMY
line: I thought you said you didn't know anything about terrorists?

speaker: MORRIS
line: I don't. But boy, do I know scams. I wasn't a Man in Black all those years for nothing. They made you work at finding Southhall. Which tells me the real guy is hiding in plain sight. Right out in the open.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: A friend of the dead Professor. A co-worker maybe.."

speaker: YVES
line: The man who saw me through the Professor's window. The one who identified me.

speaker: SPEAKER
line: Ladies and gentlemen, scientists, academic leaders and government representatives, coming together is our goal this Evening. Coming together as one. Those words are easily spoken, but guiding our missile into that fugitive and vulnerable target, is hard.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Sorry. Conference attendees only.

speaker: BYERS
line: We're reporters.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: What newspaper do you work for?

speaker: BYERS
line: Uh... uh... The Lone Gunman.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Never heard of it.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We're legit, man.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Come on. Come on. Passes. Show 'em your Press Pass.

speaker: YVES
line: Sir, it's desperately important that we get in there.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Yeah, buddy, come on.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: These expired last December.

speaker: YVES
line: We've got five minutes.

speaker: BYERS
line: Listen to me. We believe there's a dangerous man in that room.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Folks, I need all of you to step away, right now.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Look, thousands of people may die.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Mike? I got a situation over by the main conference room.

speaker: JIMMY
line: John Gillnitz! John Gillnitz!."

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Step back, sir.

speaker: JIMMY
line: I'm really sorry.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Where'd he go?

speaker: YVES
line: Split up. Four minutes left. Good luck.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, wait! What'll we do with this guy once we find him?

speaker: YVES
line: Hold him till I get there. I'll do the rest.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You mean cut him open?

speaker: YVES
line: If that virus gets into the air stream, we'll have failed. People will die. Whatever it takes...

speaker: BYERS
line: Three minutes and counting.

speaker: BYERS
line: Don't try to run.

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: I don't have to.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yves, Jimmy, we found him!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Over here!

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: What do you plan to do? By my watch, it's two minuets to eight. Not much time for surgery.

speaker: BYERS
line: Yves! Jimmy!

speaker: PROFESSOR GILLNITZ
line: Now you have a minute forty.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Guys?

speaker: BYERS
line: Whatever it takes.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Byers! Frohike! Langly!

speaker: JIMMY
line: Yves, come here!

speaker: JIMMY
line: Guys!! Guys!!

speaker: JIMMY
line: Oh god, no!!

speaker: BYERS
line: Don't, Jimmy!

speaker: YVES
line: Don't. It's too late. They're already exposed.

speaker: JIMMY
line: No, guys.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Why do you fight the good fight?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Both of you.

speaker: BYERS
line: Never give up.

speaker: KIMMY
line: in Spanish) Vayo con dios, amigos.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Arlington. You must have pulled some big strings to get those guys in here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's the least I could do.

speaker: REYES
line: Are you ready?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll catch up. They meant so much to me. I'm not sure if they ever really knew.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Nobody knew... what heroes they were.

speaker: YVES
line: It's not right. It's not.

speaker: MORRIS
line: No, it's not. Langly said to me, "The ones who never give up, they never die."

speaker: MORRIS
line: I still don't know what that means.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It means that, like everyone buried here, the world is a better place for them having been in it. It means that they're gone... but they live on through us all.
